description.narrative:
The Nederlands Agrarisch Jongeren Kontakt (NAJK) is happy to take part in the negotiations for the creation of the IMVO covenant. NAJK is a party that is important in shaping the agricultural sector of the future. NAJK represents 8,000 young farmers and gardeners. These young farmers and gardeners are the farmers of the future and therefore the ones who will have to implement the IMVO covenant. Because international societal risks and thus themes become increasingly relevant in the future, it is essential that the interests of young farmers and market gardeners are involved in this.
The added value of NAJK lies in particular in the future and sustainability. In the primary sector, young farmers and market gardeners are pre-eminently entrepreneurs withan eye for the future. They are the ones who still want to be able to practice their profession as an entrepreneur in the Netherlands in 20, 30 or 40 years. Young farmers have the future and are therefore keen to discuss the details of this. That is precisely why they deserve a representationin the negotiations for this covenant. NAJK brings specific knowledge in the field of innovative entrepreneurship, across the full breadth of Dutch agriculture and horticulture.
NAJK has previously done two projects on the theme of international corporate socialresponsibility. Together with young people actively engaged in environmental issues, NAJK has given guest lessons at schools about soy and the relationship between soy and the global south. In this way NAJK wanted to make young people aware of the choices they make and what influence that has on, among other things, the environment, soil and climate. In addition, NAJK has previously held gamenights with young people, called the BoerenBattle. In this gameevening fun, excitement, action and knowledge are combined. The youngsters had to answer questions about climate, energy, water, soil and land grab. During the game, the participants became aware of global agriculture. Each team competed for the win through questions, discussion moments, drawing assignments and active game components. Iris Bouwers has supervised the majority of the BoerenBattle meetings. NAJK has a broad and international network, through which possibly needed knowledge about and experience with harmful, social, environmental and climate chain effects in the #global south # can be gained.

participating-org.narrative: NAJK The Dutch Young Farmers Organization NAJK is the association for and by young farmers and their partners in the Netherlands. NAJK has 8000 members divided over 125 local general groups (AJK's) and groups dedicated to young agricultural women (JAV's), 10 regional groups and one national organization. Activities are performed and managed by volunteers from the organization at various levels and are supported by a professional staff. All provincial organizations are represented in the NAJK board. The Executive Board isthe preparatory and executive part of NAJK. NAJK International The international department of NAJK is responsible for all international related activities: defending member’s interests and increasing their awareness on the international scale. NAJK International organizes discussion sessions and trainings to create awareness on international topics. Furthermore, study tours and international agricultural development aid (missions) are organized to exchange the knowledge of Dutch young farmers with young farmers in developing countries.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
